alert.note: Alert for Greene; Pickens; Sumter (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 27 at 8:54PM CST until January 29 at 4:48PM CST by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Alabama... Tombigbee River At Bevill Lock and Dam affecting Greene, Sumter and Pickens Counties. .Flooding continues on the Tombigbee River and a flood warning remains in effect. The next statement will be issued Sunday afternoon, or sooner if conditions warrant. && ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL MONDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Tombigbee River at Bevill Lock and Dam. * WHEN...Until Monday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 122.0 feet, Cattle in low-lying areas of Southern Pickens County should be moved to higher ground. Cattle are cutoff in lowlands of Southern Pickens County at stages above 122 feet. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 PM CST Saturday the stage was 120.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage just after midnight tonight to a crest of 122.7 feet early tomorrow afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage early Monday morning. - Flood stage is 122.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
